programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: A group of thieves posing as True Lighter missionaries are stopped outside Dodge City. The leader wants Jennie Brandt to flirt with Earp to learn the time of a Wells Fargo gold shipment.

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: While away for the day helping Sheriff Masterson, Earp appoints Hal Norton as his Chief Deputy. Hal is forced to confront several problems while Earp is gone.

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: A bank robbery in Dodge City is foiled by the citizens while Earp is away.

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: Texan Drum Denman goes after northerner Earp by backing a free newspaper to print false stories about Earp trying to draw him out of Dodge City.

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: Custer's widow is worried about an upcoming hearing on Major Reno's actions during Custer's last stand so Earp tries to help calm her down.

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: A boxing promoter comes to Dodge City challenging men to fight Champ Starbuck for money.

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: The widow Mrs. Phillips sparks interest from Earp. At the same time, a convict Earp sent to prison escapes the chain gang and heads for Dodge City for revenge.

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: Mayor Hoover declines to run for mayor, so Judge Tobin with Earp's support asks Jim Kelley to run against Slip Madigan. Earp decides to resign to ensure Kelley's election.

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: Dr. Fabrique visits Wichita hoping for a fishing vacation. With Dr. McCarty out of town, Fabrique is forced to tend to a cattle baron's stomach ache at gunpoint.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Miami, the discovery of a mutilated body sent investigators on the trail of a deadly cult. But agents found a wall of silence around the cult's members. Potential witnesses, terrified of reprisals, refused to talk.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Surveillance video is often the most precise witness to a crime. After three brutal murders were caught on tape in Alabama, the suspects fled the area. They had an arsenal of stolen weapons, and swore they wouldn't be taken alive.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When a family was murdered in Arkansas, it seemed like an isolated event. But soon the crime was revealed to be part of an ever-widening circle of violence that defined a new age of domestic terrorism.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the 1970's a string of bank robberies and bombings spread fear and destruction along the east coast. The FBI faced a new breed of criminal, the domestic terrorist.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Louisiana, a brutal killer turned a rural area into his personal hunting ground. He preyed on the defenseless, the weak and the elderly.

programme.title: The New Detectives
programme.desc: Some cases simply can't be solved with current technology or with the evidence at hand. But that doesn't mean they'll remain unsolved forever.

programme.title: The New Detectives
programme.desc: When teenagers are driven to kill, their victims are but the first to fall. In three such cases, the families of the killers, as well as their communities, become the victims of violent crime.

programme.title: The New Detectives
programme.desc: They know as much about crime as any crime fighter, or any criminal. They're the crime writers, and through their eyes we see murder most foul.

programme.title: The New Detectives
programme.desc: For serial killers, once is never enough. For investigators, the challenge is steep when the killers murder by numbers.

programme.title: The New Detectives
programme.desc: Sometimes, the cause of death does not match the scene of the crime. When an untraceable poison is used to commit murder, homicide detectives turn to forensic toxicologists to follow a killer's tracks and expose a toxic death.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Gunslinger Johnny Drako rides into town and tells the bartender that he is looking for Lucas McCain. After Johnny leaves the saloon, Sweeney hurries to tell Lucas.

programme.title: Annie Oakley

programme.title: Annie Oakley

programme.title: Annie Oakley

programme.title: The Adventures of Jim Bowie
programme.desc: Jim's suspicions are aroused when an elderly friend dies suddenly on his wedding night.

programme.desc: Jim discovers a scheme to enrich the owners of a piece of land by getting the state to move its capital there.

programme.title: Doctor Who: Spearhead from Space

programme.title: Doctor Who: Spearhead from Space

programme.title: Doctor Who: Survival
programme.desc: The Doctor and a number of people from Perivale follow Ace to the Cheetah-People’s world, where the Master lies in wait. He cannot leave without the Doctor's assistance.

programme.title: Doctor Who: Survival

programme.title: South Park: Pip!
programme.desc: Cet épisode spécial est consacré à Pip, personnage très spécial inspiré d'un roman de Charles Dickens intitulé 'Les Grandes Espérances'. Pip est un jeune forgeron et va devoir trouver une solution pour conquérir le cœur de la belle Estella.

programme.title: South Park: Cartman adhère à la Nambla
programme.desc: Cartman en a marre des autres. Pour lui ils ne sont pas assez matures. Il décide de trouver des amis adultes sur Internet, mais tous ses amis se font envoyer en prison. Il va voir Mephesto pour avoir un ami artificiel.

programme.title: South Park: Tampons en Cheveux de Cherok
programme.desc: Kyle tombe gravement malade, et en ville tout le monde ne jure que par la médecine à base de plantes des indiens. La mère de Kyle refuse alors de faire hospitaliser son fils croyant qu'il ira mieux avec les plantes.

programme.title: South Park: Chef Pète les Plombs
programme.desc: Chef est scandalisé : le drapeau de South Park est selon lui raciste. Afin d'en juger avec la plus grande impartialité, il est demandé aux enfants de décider s'il faut changer ou non le drapeau.

programme.title: South Park: Un Truc Qu'on Peut Faire Avec le Doigt
programme.desc: Cartman décide de mettre à exécution le rêve qu'il vient de faire : monter un groupe de musique avec les autres garçons pour gagner '10 millions de dollars'.

programme.title: South Park: Les handicapés vont-ils en enfer?
programme.desc: Le Pasteur décide de parler de l'enfer. Il fait alors peur aux enfants en leur disant que s'ils ne sont pas de bons chrétiens, ils périront dans les flammes de l'enfer. Les enfants, décident alors de devenir de bons chrétiens.

programme.title: South Park: Probablement
programme.desc: Dans l'épisode précédent, les garçons découvrent le Pasteur en plein acte sexuel dans son église. Cartman décide de prendre les choses en main afin de remettre dans le droit chemin tous les enfants de la ville.

programme.title: South Park: CM1
